i18n.components.header_website.support_a: Navigate to documentation on how to support Scribe
i18n.components.landing_splash.scribe_lo: The Scribe logo: The word 'Scribe' with a swipe up from the 'e' leading to a pencil.
i18n.components.landing_tech_banner.open: Nothing that Scribe builds would be possible without open data from Wikidata, so we're dedicated to working in the open. Please join us on GitHub and Matrix if you'd like to contribute to or learn more about our projects.
Expand or collapse the right sidebar
i18n.error.return_home_aria_label: Return to the Scribe home page
i18n.error.title: Error • Scribe
i18n.pages.index.conjugate_aria_label: Learn more about the Scribe conjugation applications
i18n.pages.index.conjugate_img_alt_text: The UI of the Scribe Conjugate app with the conjugations of the French verb to be.
i18n.pages.index.conjugate_text: We're developing advanced verb conjugation applications based on open data. Get all verb conjugations found in Wikidata in a streamlined UI that lets you search for verbs in multiple languages at the same time. All this without ads or your data going to third parties.
i18n.pages.index.infrastructure_aria_lab: Learn more about Scribe language data infrastructure
i18n.pages.index.infrastructure_img_alt_: A graphic showing connected data nodes with the Scribe-Server and Scribe-Data logos over it.
i18n.pages.index.infrastructure_text: Our Wikidata language data processes are open for all to use. Leverage Scribe-Data to get language packs of all data from the Wikidata Query Service or Wikidata dumps in a convenient command line interface. You can also make calls to the Scribe-Server API that our client applications use to get language data updates.
i18n.pages.index.language_keyboards_aria: Learn more about the Scribe language keyboard applications
i18n.pages.index.language_keyboards_img_: An expose of the command bar and annotation features of Scribe Language Keyboards above a German keyboard.
i18n.pages.index.language_keyboards_text: Our flagship application is Scribe Language Keyboards — mobile keyboards that are tailored to help language learners communicate in their second language. Scribe keyboards can be used in any app and help users with translation, verb conjugation, noun genders and much more!
i18n.pages.index.our_supporters_text: Help us create and maintain our open-source language learning software. Please consider contributing your skills, reach or money.
i18n.pages.index.scribe_community_img_al: A globe graphic with icons representing development, design, translation, communication and teamwork.
i18n.pages.index.scribe_section_btn_aria: Learn more about the Scribe community
i18n.pages.index.scribe_section_text: We're a global community of language enthusiasts, learners and developers creating tools to help people communicate with confidence. An official Wikimedia project for new developers, we strive to create an inclusive environment in all aspects of our work.
i18n.pages.index.title: Welcome
